title: Steuerstrich / Lubberline Glyph?
content:
Has anyone come across a glyph called 'steuerstrich' or have any idea what it might be used for typographically speaking?

Bonus points to show example of usage.
author: Michael Hernan

comments.content: Oh that title looks gorgeous in Hermes.

Steuerstrich is the German word for [lubber line](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015200204/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lubber_line). It is an essential marking on a compass. As it usually is just a simple line, I have no idea why one would need to have a glyph for it.
